sentences: Palun võtaksid need paberid endaga kaasa.
context: The word 'võtaksid' is the conditional/plural form of the Estonian verb 'võtma', which means 'to take'. In this case, it's in the conditional mood (potentialis) and plural form (3rd person plural), so it translates to English as 'would take', 'could take', or 'might take' depending on context. This form is used when expressing a hypothetical action that might happen under certain conditions.
